column4: yeah i know how to ask questions. Here's my issue: My microphone isnt working (intel-hda ich7 familiy soundcard). Thus i tried to manually compile the new alsa-drivers 1.0.13rc3, but when i type  cat /proc/asound/version i still get alsa version 1.0.10 @ wols_
hopefully i described my issue this time precicly enough ;)
alsa drivers are in the kernel, ull need to replace the kernel module with ur new compiled driver

not sure where make install installs those ull have to read and find out, if they are put int he right /lib/modules dir then u prolly have to modprobe -r ur existing modules then modprobe the new modules, use lsmod to make sure they get removed
